abstract: New York Mets pitcher Zack Wheeler, who underwent Tommy John surgery last season, is not expected to return to rotation until July, giving him total of 15 months to recover.
lead_paragraph: Wheeler, who continues to recover from Tommy John surgery, is not expected to rejoin the rotation until around July 1, leaving his teammates to prepare for the start of the season without him.

headline.main: Mets’ Zack Wheeler, Recovering From Surgery, Practices Patience
headline.print_headline: Mets’ Wheeler, Recovering From Surgery, Practices Patience

snippet: Wheeler, who continues to recover from Tommy John surgery, is not expected to rejoin the rotation until around July 1, leaving his teammates to prepare for the start of the season without him.
